oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1958-01-18 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from January 18, 1958. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Porter Wagoner (host/performer), guest performer Hank Locklin, and regular performers Rod Brasfield, Tommy Jackson, Chet Atkins, Minnie Pearl, and Stringbean. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 953rd broadcast, though in fact it is likely the 954th.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Porter Wagoner; Rod Brasfield; Hank Locklin; Tommy Jackson
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Porter Wagoner -- Pay Day (Porter Wagoner) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner, Porter Wagoner) -- Porter Wagoner introduces Rod Brasfield -- Comedy routine (Rod Brasfield, Porter Wagoner) -- Porter Wagoner introduces Hank Locklin -- Geisha Girl (Hank Locklin) -- Prince Albert commercial (Rod Brasfield, Porter Wagoner) -- Porter Wagoner introduces Tommy Jackson -- Grey Eagle (Tommy Jackson fiddle) -- Porter Wagoner talks -- What Would You Do (If Jesus Came To Your House) (Porter Wagoner)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); United States. Armed Forces Radio Service; Turner, Grant; Brasfield, Rod; Minnie Pearl; Atkins, Chet; Stringbean, 1915-1973; Jackson, Tommy; Wagoner, Porter; Locklin, Hank
